SENT.plain: Amongst 166 patients with aneurysms, ectasia or megaloarteries shown on coronary angiograms, 86.1% had dilated vessels as part of generalised coronary sclerosis (usually in patients with three-vessel disease)
In 9%, dilatation was of iatrogenic origin and in 4.8% it was idiopathic
Amongst 9 000 patients, there were eight with megalo-arteries without stenosis; six of these had atypical angina and three suffered an infarct
Patients with definite dilatation of the coronary artery and stagnation of contrast flow required treatment
